name: Dumbbell Lunges Standing
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step forward with your right foot and lower your body until your back knee is almost touching the ground. Keep your front thigh parallel to the ground and your weight evenly distributed between both legs.
3. Push through your front heel to return to standing, but do not let your back knee touch the ground. Repeat the movement on the other side by stepping forward with your left foot.
4. Continue alternating legs in this manner, keeping your core engaged and your movements controlled throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Dumbbell lunges are a lower body exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes, and calves, helping to improve balance and mobility.
